voice_characteristics.tone: Description of overall tone (e.g., Direct, professional, action-oriented)
voice_characteristics.sentence_structure: Description of sentence patterns (e.g., Short, punchy. Avg 14 words. Favors simple sentences.)
voice_characteristics.vocabulary: Description of word choice (e.g., Professional but accessible. Common terms: ..., Avoided terms: ...)
voice_characteristics.formatting: Description of formatting preferences (e.g., Heavy bullet point usage. Markdown formatting. Bold for emphasis.)
opening_patterns: Example opening pattern 1 (e.g., I've reviewed {topic} and have {number} recommendations.)
closing_patterns: Example closing pattern 1 (e.g., Let me know if you need clarification.)
voice_characteristics.argument_structure: How arguments are structured (e.g., Leads with conclusion 72%. Uses data/evidence 84%. Low hedging.)
voice_characteristics.distinctive_markers: Unique stylistic markers (e.g., Uses em dashes. Contractions rare. Analytical framing.)

examples.text: [Full email text - will be populated during analysis]
examples.context: Description of the email context (e.g., Email to superintendent re: AI policy)

voice_characteristics.structure: Overall blog structure preferences (e.g., Chronological flow. Subheadings for scannability.)
voice_characteristics.narrative_elements: Use of quotes, stories, case studies (e.g., Staff quotes frequently (67%))
voice_characteristics.framing: How ideas are framed (e.g., Progress-oriented, not prescriptive. Collaborative rather than hierarchical.)

voice_characteristics.formatting: LinkedIn-specific formatting (hashtags, line breaks, emojis, etc.)
voice_characteristics.engagement_style: How posts invite engagement (e.g., Questions, calls for input, sharing experiences)

voice_characteristics.structure: Overall report organization (e.g., Executive summary first, findings, recommendations)
voice_characteristics.data_presentation: How data and evidence are presented
voice_characteristics.recommendation_style: How recommendations are framed and supported
voice_characteristics.formality_level: Level of formality for institutional reports

notes: This template provides the structure for voice profiles.
Geoffrey will populate voice_characteristics and examples by analyzing writing samples.
Confidence scores are based on sample count: 50+ = 0.85+, 20-49 = 0.70-0.84, <20 = <0.70
Examples should include representative samples that capture key voice characteristics.
The full sample texts are stored to allow Geoffrey to re-read them during content generation.
